posts.title: George Floyd Live Updates: Officer Derek Chauvin Charged With Murder
posts.description: The former police officer seen on video using his knee to pin down George Floyd, a black man who later died, has been taken into custody and charged with third-degree murder.

posts.title: George Floyd Death: How the Knee-on-Neck Hold Resulted in Tragedy
posts.description: Police departments have tried to ban or severely limit the use of chokeholds and neck restraints. But in Minneapolis, a knee pressing on a neck led to a man’s death.
posts.author: Neil MacFarquhar

posts.title: Protests in Minnesota Renew Scrutiny of Klobuchar’s Record as Prosecutor
posts.description: Amy Klobuchar, now being considered as a potential vice-presidential candidate, oversaw several cases involving police shootings in Minneapolis during her years as a prosecutor.
posts.author: Nick Corasaniti and Katie Glueck

posts.title: How Trump's Twitter Remarks Escalate Growing Crisis in Minneapolis
posts.description: The president’s tweets prompted Twitter to append them with a note saying the posts were “glorifying violence.” Joe Biden condemned Mr. Trump, saying “it’s no time to encourage violence.”
posts.author: Maggie Haberman and Alexander Burns

posts.title: Twitter Places Warning on Trump Minneapolis Tweet, Saying It Glorified Violence
posts.description: The president’s tweet, which implied that protesters in Minneapolis could be shot, could not be viewed without reading a brief notice, and users were blocked from liking or replying to it.
posts.author: Peter Baker, Raymond Zhong and Russell Goldman

posts.title: How Trump’s Tweets Cause Collateral Damage for Families Already in Pain
posts.description: The president’s baseless insinuations about the death of Lori Klausutis reflect a callous pattern that can leave even ordinary people facing threats from his supporters long after he has moved on.
posts.author: Patricia Mazzei, Jennifer Medina, Maggie Haberman and Sydney Ember

posts.title: Live Coronavirus News and Updates
posts.description: New York City could start reopening on June 8, the governor said. Economists say that the path ahead for the economy is wildly uncertain. The House has trimmed its summer schedule.

posts.title: N.Y.C. Is Expected to Begin Reopening June 8: Live Updates
posts.description: Governor Cuomo said he thought the city would meet health benchmarks by then. He also cleared five upstate regions for broader reopening.

posts.title: Inside an Extraordinary G.O.P. Event: ‘Pressing Flesh and Kissing Babies’ Again
posts.description: At the South Carolina event, attended by Senators Lindsey Graham and Tim Scott, there were few masks and no social distancing — and that was the point.
posts.author: Astead W. Herndon

posts.title: Live Stock Market News During the Coronavirus Pandemic
posts.description: The latest on stock market and business news during the coronavirus outbreak.

posts.title: Forget Swooshes and V’s. The Economy’s Future Is a Question Mark.
posts.description: Is it a V, an L or a W? Economists are giving up on assigning a letter to the wildly uncertain recovery that lies ahead.
posts.author: Jeanna Smialek

posts.title: Pandemic Forces Car Dealers to Do the Unthinkable: Sell Online
posts.description: Dealerships have long resisted e-commerce, but with many showrooms closed, the dynamic is changing.
posts.author: Neal E. Boudette

posts.title: Economic Giants Are Restarting. Here’s What It Means for Climate Change.
posts.description: Want to know whether the world can avert catastrophe? Watch the recovery plans coming out now in Europe, China and the United States.
posts.author: Somini Sengupta

posts.title: Coronavirus Live World Updates: Moscow, Spain, Israel
posts.description: Spain approves a minimum guaranteed income for 850,000 households. Israel’s daily cases jump.

posts.title: Its Coronavirus Caseload Soaring, India Is Reopening Anyway
posts.description: Worried for its economy, India loosened tough restrictions and may lift them entirely this weekend. But infection numbers are climbing fast.
posts.author: Kai Schultz and Sameer Yasir

posts.title: How ‘Quiz’, a Drama About Coughing, Captivated Lockdown Britain
posts.description: The show, about a couple who cheated on a game show, is coming to AMC. It wasn’t just a hit in Britain; it changed attitudes toward one of that country’s strangest crimes.
posts.author: Alex Marshall

posts.title: One Hundred Thousand Lives
posts.description: A dictionary collector. A wind chaser. A disco dancer. They are just a few of the more than 100,000 lost to the coronavirus in the U.S.

posts.title: A Trump vs. Twitter Week
posts.description: It’s a pandemic, protests against police brutality are gripping the country, and the president of the United States and Twitter are battling it out.
posts.author: Shira Ovide

posts.title: Sign Up: ‘Watching’
posts.description: Get recommendations on the best TV shows and movies to watch.
posts.author: The New York Times

posts.title: George Floyd's Death Shows the State Fails Black People
posts.description: The collapse of politics and governance leaves no other option.
posts.author: Keeanga-Yamahtta Taylor

posts.title: Tony Kushner: Larry Kramer Howled the Truths We Needed to Hear
posts.description: The playwright sacrificed his art in favor of an unrelenting commitment to activism.
posts.author: Tony Kushner

posts.title: What Can We Learn from the Coronavirus in Prisons
posts.description: Research on the pandemic behind bars, ethically conducted, could help everyone.
posts.author: Marc M. Howard

posts.title: After the Coronavirus, We Can Build a Better Child Care System
posts.description: The coronavirus has highlighted how necessary good child care is.
posts.author: Shantel Meek and Conor P. Williams

posts.title: The ‘Liberal World Order’ Was Built With Blood
posts.description: As the United States reckons with its decline, it should understand where its power came from in the first place.
posts.author: Vincent Bevins
categories: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

posts.title: If We Had a Real Leader
posts.description: Imagining Covid under a normal president.
posts.author: David Brooks

posts.title: On the Economics of Not Dying
posts.description: What good is increasing G.D.P. if it kills you?
posts.author: Paul Krugman

posts.title: Did You Really Think Trump Would Mourn With Us?
posts.description: The president’s indifference to collective grieving is of a piece with a political movement that denies our collective ties.
posts.author: Jamelle Bouie

posts.title: Why George Floyd Won't Be the Last American Killed by the Police
posts.description: Videos of state-sponsored killings have been going viral for years. Little has changed.
posts.author: Spencer Bokat-Lindell

posts.title: Coronavirus Isn't Killing NYC's Small Businesses. Rent Is.
posts.description: It won’t be Amazon or the coronavirus. It will be artificially high rents.
posts.author: Sarah McNally

posts.title: Jimmy Lai: Does Hong Kong Have a Fighting Chance Against China?
posts.description: The Communist Party was always going to try to tame Hong Kong, but its latest efforts are something else.
posts.author: Jimmy Lai

posts.title: Is It Safe to Keep Employing a Cleaner? Wrong Question, Lady
posts.description: Introducing your new Work Friend: Roxane Gay.
posts.author: Roxane Gay

posts.title: These Athletes Had the Coronavirus. Will They Ever Be the Same?
posts.description: Von Miller of the Denver Broncos called the disease a “surreal” experience and said he struggled at first to workout. Other athletes have endured lingering lung and other health issues.
posts.author: Andrew Keh

posts.title: Charges Recommended Against 3 Officers Involved in Violent N.Y. Arrest
posts.description: The charges would be in connection with a May 2 incident during which an officer sat on a man’s neck.
posts.author: Ashley Southall

posts.title: Congress Calls State Dept. Officials for Interviews in Expanded Pompeo Inquiry
posts.description: Lawmakers are investigating whether Secretary of State Mike Pompeo urged President Trump to fire Steve A. Linick, the department’s inspector general, to shield himself from Mr. Linick’s inquiries.
posts.author: Edward Wong

posts.title: Knights of Columbus Founder, Who Died in a Pandemic, Moves Closer to Sainthood
posts.description: Pope Francis has credited a 2015 miracle to the Rev. Michael J. McGivney, a Connecticut priest who died in 1890 during an outbreak that researchers now believe may have been caused by a coronavirus.
posts.author: Sandra E. Garcia

posts.title: Margaret Maughan, Medal-Winning Wheelchair Athlete, Dies at 91
posts.description: Paralyzed from the waist down, she won gold in archery and swimming at the first Paralympic Games in 1960 and became an advocate of sports as therapy.
posts.author: Katharine Q. Seelye

posts.title: Germany Wants E.U. to Sanction Head of Russian Military Intelligence
posts.description: Berlin plans to invoke a new European sanctions mechanism to target a hacker who orchestrated a cyberattack on the German Parliament — and the head of Russian intelligence himself.
posts.author: Katrin Bennhold

posts.title: Older Italians Warily Eye Young Crowds, Fearing 2nd Coronavirus Wave
posts.description: As the country cautiously emerges from lockdown, anxieties have centered on public gatherings of teenagers and young adults — unfairly, some experts say.
posts.author: Emma Bubola

posts.title: Hydrogen as Fuel? An Italian Pasta Factory Shows How It Could Work
posts.description: A producer of orecchiette and paccheri is using the potentially clean energy source in a trial.
posts.author: Stanley Reed

posts.title: Bank Regulator’s Battle With Anti-Redlining Law Comes to an End
posts.description: Joseph Otting, the top overseer of the country’s largest banks, drew from his own experiences as a banker to rewrite rules for the Community Reinvestment Act. Not everyone is on board.
posts.author: Emily Flitter and Jeanna Smialek

posts.title: The TV Commercial, Once Advertising’s Main Event, Suffers in the Pandemic
posts.description: People are watching more television these days. But companies are spending less time, effort and money on TV ads.
posts.author: Tiffany Hsu

posts.title: Making Home Safe for Kids This Summer
posts.description: Experts identify common hazards in the home and what can be done to prevent accidents.
posts.author: Jolie Kerr

posts.title: Telemedicine for Home Repairs?
posts.description: The coronavirus has made homeowners wary of inviting workers into their homes, but some contractors can make a diagnosis virtually.
posts.author: Ronda Kaysen

posts.title: How to Recover From Covid-19 at Home
posts.description: Rest and fluids are essential, but not always enough. Here are some more things you can do to feel better.
posts.author: Maggie Astor

posts.title: It’s Not Too Late to Get a Virtual Internship
posts.description: Here’s how college students whose summer plans fell through can line up virtual internships.
posts.author: Lisa Heffernan

posts.title: How to Prepare Your Dog to Be Left at Home Alone (Again)
posts.description: Whether your dog is new or old, these tips will help ease its transition from lockdown to normal life.
posts.author: Jen A. Miller

posts.title: No Touch, No Hands-On Learning, for Now, as Museums Try to Reopen
posts.description: Science and children’s museums are studying how to rethink their many tactile exhibits to keep people safe.
posts.author: Julia Jacobs

posts.title: Whether You’re Making a Meal or Cleaning an Oil Spill, There’s a Fungus for That
posts.description: In “Entangled Life,” the biologist Merlin Sheldrake shines a celebratory spotlight on the little understood features and functions of fungal networks.
posts.author: Jennifer Szalai
categories: Entangled Life: How Fungi Make Our Worlds, Change Our Minds, and Shape Our Futures (Book)

posts.title: ‘Circumstantial Pleasures’ Review: The Lyrical Junkman Cometh
posts.description: A new movie by Lewis Klahr, who makes striking, personal assemblages out of cultural detritus.
posts.author: Manohla Dargis

posts.title: Richard Herd, a Baffled Boss on ‘Seinfeld,’ Is Dead at 87
posts.description: A busy character actor, he also appeared on several science-fiction shows, including “Star Trek: The Next Generation,” on which he played a Klingon.
posts.author: Richard Sandomir

posts.title: ‘You’ll Never Walk Alone’: From Broadway Tear-Jerker to Covid-Era Anthem
posts.description: Versions of the “Carousel” song by Aretha Franklin, Gerry and the Pacemakers and Liverpool F.C. fans have turned it into something universal.
posts.author: Elisabeth Vincentelli

posts.title: Big Pharmacy Chains Also Fed the Opioid Epidemic, Court Filing Says
posts.description: New details emerge in a lawsuit asserting that chains including CVS, Rite Aid and Walgreens sold millions of pills in small towns but rarely flagged suspicious orders to authorities.
posts.author: Jan Hoffman

posts.title: Trump’s Vaccine Chief Has Vast Ties to Drug Industry, Posing Possible Conflicts
posts.description: Moncef Slaoui, a former pharmaceutical executive, is now overseeing the U.S. initiative to develop coronavirus treatments and vaccines. His financial interests and corporate roles have come under scrutiny.
posts.author: Sheila Kaplan, Matthew Goldstein and Alexandra Stevenson

posts.title: When Coral’s Colorful Show Is a Sign That It’s Sick
posts.description: Under stress, certain coral species put on displays to try to re-attract symbiotic algae they need to survive.
posts.author: David Waldstein

posts.title: Fear of Covid-19 Leads Other Patients to Decline Critical Treatment
posts.description: Psychologists say anxiety and uncertainty prompt irrational decisions — like turning down a transplant when an organ becomes available.
posts.author: Katie Hafner

posts.title: Why Amy Cooper’s Use of ‘African-American’ Stung
posts.description: In a racist confrontation with a black bird-watcher in Central Park, her choice of words was striking.
posts.author: Ginia Bellafante

posts.title: Trump’s ‘Horrifying Lies’ About Lori Klausutis May Cross a Legal Line
posts.description: The president’s innuendo about the death of a congressional staffer in 2001 could lead to a costly court judgment against him.
posts.author: Peter H. Schuck

posts.title: Try Vertex
posts.description: Connect the dots to reveal the hidden picture.
posts.author: The New York Times

posts.title: The Crossword, Tiles and More
posts.description: Solve the daily puzzle edited by Will Shortz, or try out other games like the Mini and Letter Boxed.
posts.author: The New York Times

posts.title: Try Spelling Bee
posts.description: Puzzle throughout the day to see how many words you can find.
posts.author: The New York Times
